SqlAuthenticationProvider.summary: Defines the core behavior of authentication providers and provides a base class for derived classes.
SqlAuthenticationProvider.remarks: Derived classes must provide a parameterless constructor if they can be instantiated from the app.config file.

BeforeLoad.summary: This method is called immediately before the provider is added to the SQL authentication provider registry.
BeforeLoad.remarks:
Avoid performing long-waiting tasks in this method, since it can block other threads from accessing the provider registry.
This method must not throw.

BeforeUnload.summary: This method is called immediately before the provider is removed from the SQL authentication provider registry.
BeforeUnload.remarks:
For example, this method is called when a different provider with the same authentication method overrides this provider in the SQL authentication provider registry. Avoid performing long-waiting task in this method, since it can block other threads from accessing the provider registry.
This method must not throw.

IsSupported.summary: Indicates whether the specified authentication method is supported.
IsSupported.returns: if the specified authentication method is supported; otherwise, .

AcquireTokenAsync.summary: Acquires an access token from the authority.
AcquireTokenAsync.param: The parameters passed to the provider by the driver.
AcquireTokenAsync.returns: Represents an asynchronous operation that returns the AD authentication token.

GetProvider.summary: Gets an authentication provider by method.
GetProvider.returns: The authentication provider or if not found.

SetProvider.summary: Sets an authentication provider by method.
SetProvider.returns: if the operation succeeded; otherwise, (for example, the existing provider disallows overriding).
